Mission 08: Figurative Language

Determine Meaning of Words and Figurative Language

[SYSTEM NOTIFICATION]
A Literary Gate has been detected. Difficulty: C-Rank.
Hunter Hyro, master the power of figurative language - words that mean more than they seem!

The Challenge Awaits

Figurative language uses words in creative ways to paint vivid pictures and express ideas powerfully. Like learning to decode enemy signals, understanding figurative language unlocks deeper meaning.

Your mission? Master metaphors, similes, personification, and other literary devices through multiple practice worksheets.

Hunter Equipment

  • Pencil and highlighter
  • Figurative language reference guide
  • Dictionary for word meanings

Skills to Unlock

Power Standard PS8
The student will determine the meaning of words, phrases, and figurative language.

Training Scrolls

Key Figurative Language Types:

  • Simile: Comparison using "like" or "as" (fast as lightning)
  • Metaphor: Direct comparison (life is a journey)
  • Personification: Giving human qualities to non-human things
  • Hyperbole: Extreme exaggeration
  • Idiom: Expressions that mean something different than literal words

Dungeon Raid

Official Quest Instructions

Students will complete multiple worksheets demonstrating understanding of figurative language, reference materials, related words, and root words.

Raid Strategy Guide

Step 1: Learn the Types

Review the different types of figurative language listed above. Know what makes each one unique.

Step 2: Identify Context Clues

Look for surrounding words that help you understand unfamiliar phrases. Context is your best weapon.

Step 3: Break Down Root Words

Many words share roots from Greek or Latin. If you know the root, you can figure out related words.

Step 4: Use Reference Materials

Dictionaries, thesauruses, and glossaries are powerful tools. Know how to use them efficiently.

Step 5: Complete All Worksheets

Work through each worksheet carefully. These skills build on each other!
